Dear Courtney Atkins:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
February 7, 2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
• (4) At least 1 adult member of the household must
have training in and maintain a current certification
in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation from
the American Heart Association or the American
Red Cross, or other institution approved by the
department.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not have documentation one adult
household member maintained current CPR/First Aid certification as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
1/9/2024 RENEWAL, CAP 2/6/2024
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (2) The annual reevaluation must include a
determination and assessment of all the following:
• (d) Compliance with the licensing rules for
foster homes.
One of three foster home files reviewed had a water hazard on the property and the
home did not have door alarms that met licensing requirements, and this was not
addressed/corrected during annual licensing visit.
2

CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and
make a licensing recommendation to the
department at least 15 calendar days before the
expiration date of the foster home license.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not have the reevaluation completed
and licensing recommendation made to the department within 15 calendar days of
the expiration date of the foster home license as required.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to
possible noncompliance with any foster home
rule, the agency must do all the following:
• (a) Submit a special investigation record to
the department's licensing authority within 5
working days in the manner prescribed by
the department.
One of one special investigation reviewed did not have documentation a special
investigation record was submitted to the department's licensing authority within 5
working days as required.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the
evaluation, an agency shall complete a written
report that includes all the following information:
• (a) The date the information was received.
One of one special investigation reviewed did not have a completed report within 15
days of the conclusion of the evaluation as required.
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record
• (3) The record must contain all the following
information:
• (g) A photograph taken at least annually.
3

One of three independent living files reviewed did not have youth picture updated
annually as required.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
Two of three independent living files reviewed did not have IL agreements
completed and reviewed with youth at least once every 90 days as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
1/9/2024 RENEWAL, CAP approved 2/6/2024

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during the licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency interim inspection was completed on 1/9/24 and the CAP was
approved on 2/6/24. The agency was cited for 13 violations, 2 of which were
repeated this year. Of those 2, the number of individual incidents of non-
compliance remained the same. In 2023, 6 violations were established, none of
4

which were repeated this year. The agency will need to establish additional
corrective planning for the repeated violations to ensure a reduction of incidents.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated the previous year CAP has a positive impact on overall compliance. The
strategies identified in the CAP focused on training and enhanced supervisory
oversight. In addition, utilizing One Note has been successful because it requires
manager and 2nd line to work from the same document. The assessment noted
the agency has faced staffing challenges over the past year. They have been
purchasing out a higher rate of foster care cases and there are currently 2 open
foster care positions that they have not been able to fill.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
An interview was conducted with one staff face-to-face. Staff reported the agency
has implemented some strategies that have positively impacted overall
compliance. The agency has recently experienced some staffing changes and are
hopeful they will continue to show improvement over the next review period.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were two identified safety alerts.
Safety Alert #1: The home is missing a smoke alarm between the children's
bedroom and the rest of the home, the master bedroom and the rest of the home
and is also missing a carbon monoxide detector.
Resolution: Foster care worker provided the caregiver with a carbon
monoxide/smoke detector combo as well as another smoke detector to address the
safety issues. Pictures were provided to verify the items were installed as required.
Safety Alert #2: The home is missing a smoke alarm between the bedrooms and the
rest of the home.
Resolution: Caregivers were provided a smoke alarm which was installed and
observed to be in working order. Pictures were provided as verification.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
